basics.name: Kathryn Nakagawa
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am an undergraduate student studying for a BA in Computer Science at the University of Hawai'i at Manoa, and have passed all the required classes to obtain a minor in Business. I expect to graduate in Spring, 2027.

work.company: UH Manoa Kennedy Theater Costume Shop
work.summary: Seamstress that make costumes for the semester shows
highlights: Start and continue costume projects for upcoming performances
Maintain and upkeep the work area, machines, and inventory for the shop

work.summary: Assists ICS 101 students during their computer labs
highlights: Aid students that are falling behind/confused to ensure the whole class is keeping up
Help any Assistant TAs with planning their lab activities

volunteer.organization: Center for Renewable Energy and Island Sustainability
volunteer.summary: Lead developer for weather sensing project
highlights: Design firmware for distributed weather sensor network
Maintain custom data collection and storage infrastructure

awards.title: B+ Scholarship
awards.summary: Scholarships awarded to incoming freshmen and continuing students who complete a rigorous high school curriculum with a minimum overall GPA of 3.0 at a Hawai'i public school.

awards.title: First place
awards.summary: My team won first place in 2015.  See my portfolio site for more details.
